subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates continuously monitor the sales floor visually, paying attention to shelf emptiness and customer inquiries about product availability.
success_criteria: Sales associates actively scan the sales floor during their shifts.

subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates receive automated alerts on their handheld devices when RFID sensors detect a stock-out.
success_criteria: RFID system is functioning correctly and sending alerts.
Sales associates are receiving and acknowledging alerts.

subprocess_flow.description: Upon observation or alert, sales associates physically verify the stock-out by checking the shelf and immediate surrounding area.
success_criteria: Physical confirmation of stock-out on the shelf.

subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates gather necessary product information, including product ID, location on the sales floor (aisle, shelf number), and estimated time the stock-out was noticed.
success_criteria: All required product information is accurately collected.

subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates report the stock-out to the Inventory Management Team using either the manual stock-out reporting form or the electronic reporting function on their handheld devices.
success_criteria: Stock-out report is submitted to the Inventory Management Team.
Report includes all necessary product and location details.

subprocess_flow.description: The Inventory Management Team acknowledges receipt of the stock-out report.
success_criteria: Inventory Management Team has acknowledged receipt of the report.
